diffs.old_text: Synthetic PDF Dataset Generation This document serves as a base template for generating synthetic PDF pairs with known differences. The generator applies various modifications including text changes, formatting adjustments, and structural alterations. Text Modifications The system can apply synonym swaps, paraphrasing, typo insertion, and punctuation changes. Key observation: small layout shifts can fragment into many local diffs.

diffs.old_text: Synthetic PDF Dataset Generation This document serves as a base template for generating synthetic PDF pairs with known differences. The generator applies various modifications including text changes, formatting adjustments, and structural alterations. Text Modifications The system can apply synonym swaps, paraphrasing, typo insertion, and punctuation changes. Key observation: small layout shifts can fragment into many local diffs.
diffs.new_text: Synthetic PDF Dataset Generation This document serves as a base template for generating synthetic PDF pairs with known differences. The generator applies various modifications including text changes, formatting adjustments, and structural alterations. Text Modifications The system can apply synonym swaps, paraphrasing, typo insertion, and punctuation changes. Key observation: small layout shifts can fragment into many local diffs. Extended Content Section This page demonstrates how the generator handles multi-page documents. Paragraphs are distributed across pages, and modifications can occur on any page. The evaluation framework uses these synthetic pairs to measure detection accuracy, false positive rates, and the ability to correctly classify different types of changes. Constraint: preserve semantics while perturbing formatting. Formula: ${1}$x^{2}$dx}=$1/3

diffs.old_text: These modifications test the ability to detect subtle content differences while maintaining document structure. Formatting Changes Font size adjustments and spacing modifications are applied to test formatting-aware comparison. These changes simulate real-world scenarios where documents are reformatted without altering content. Key observation: small layout shifts can fragment into many local diffs.

diffs.new_text: Synthetic PDF Dataset Generation This document serves as a base template for generating synthetic PDF pairs with known differences. The generator applies various modifications including text changes, formatting adjustments, and structural alterations. Text Modifications The system can apply synonym swaps, paraphrasing, typo insertion, and punctuation changes. Extended Content Section This page demonstrates how the generator handles multi-page documents. Paragraphs are distributed across pages, and modifications can occur on any page. The evaluation framework uses these synthetic pairs to measure detection accuracy, false positive rates, and the ability to correctly classify different types of changes. Note: this section includes mixed fonts and vector graphics blocks.
